revised_title: Jewish Representation in the Royal Society: A Historical and Ecological Analysis
tldr: This article explores the overrepresentation of Jewish members in the Royal Society and examines the historical and social factors that contributed to this phenomenon. The author discusses the impact of the May Laws in Russia, which led to a wave of Jewish migration to Western Europe and North America, and how this wave of highly educated and intellectually gifted individuals influenced the composition of the Royal Society. The author also highlights the importance of considering social and economic factors when analyzing the intellectual potential of different communities.
